result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy J Randle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, all other applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil jdugment upon release to Extended Supervision but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.  
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED. Vocational/educational training.

No drugs.  No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim, her family, Valerie P., Sha-Ron M. and coactor April Kyle.

Sex offender assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Cognitive behavior therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay mandatory surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and  body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  The Court informed defendant he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy J Randle in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Troy J Randle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Rochelle M.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 40 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 451 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex Offender assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*No contact with the victim, her family, Valerie P., Sha-Ron M, and co-actor April Kyle.
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  
The Court informed the defendant that he cannot engage in an occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires him to work or interact primarily and directly with children under 16 years of age.  
No unsupervised contact with children under the age of 16.

Court ordered restitution set at $0.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearmsand body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10,11 AND 12:
State's motion to dismiss and read-in counts 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11 and 12 granted by the court.
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Troy J Randle in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Troy J Randle in custody.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(2), a Class C Felony.
